Understate: The claim may be understating the level of male dominance in the Legislature by stating that men hold 80% of the lawmaking power, when in fact they comprise only 49% of the population.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there should be an equal representation of men and women in the Legislature based on their population percentages, which may not necessarily be a valid assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or data to support the statement that men hold 80% of the lawmaking power in the Legislature.
